sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Iohannes de Rupescissa OFM, Liber de consideratione quintae essentiae. RamÛn Lull, Tertia distinctio. Alchemical Tracts
Alchemica
msDesc.p: Vellum and paper, 219 146 8.7 x 5.5, ff. 2 + 133 + 1, mostly 30 lines to a page. Cent. xv, in various hands of foreign aspect, apparently Catalan.
Collation: 2 flyleaves, 120-620 (outer and middle sheets vellum, except in 3) 7 (thirteen), one flyleaf.

msItem.head: Iohannes de Rupescissa OFM, Quinta essentia

head.title: Liber de consideratione quintae essentiae [per Ioannem de Rupescissa]

msItem.rubric: Primus liber de consideratione quinte essencie omnium rerum transmutabilium. In nomine domini nostri Ihesu Christi. Incipit liber de famulatu philosophie datus ab angelis domini nostri Ihesu Christi pauperibus euangelicis viris
msItem.ab: Sixteenth century notes from Ecclus. iii, John xvii and: o curas hominum o quantum est in rebus inane
msItem.incipit: Dixit Salomon sapientie capitulo septimo. Deus dedit michi horum scienciam
Secretum primum est. quia per virtutem quam contulit deus
msItem.explicit: in eius absencia aqua ardens. Deo omnipotenti patri pariterque filio suo atque spiritui santo sit laus per infinita secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit liber (2us) de consideratione quinte essencie omnium rerum pauperibus et euangelicis viris erogatum

ab.quote: cum figuris illius plantae haud ineleganter illuminatis

msItem.rubric: Hic sequuntur virtutes lunarie prout habetur in libris hermetis
msItem.incipit: Quedam est planta que dicitur (borisa uel) loathii in latino vero vocatur lunaria
msItem.explicit: figura ipsius herbe sequitur in foliis sequentibus

ab.decoNote: Coloured drawings by an earlier hand:
Two plants. At top, Sun and Moon
Youth in blue gown holding up label inscribed: certes alli desus se troba que es stellaria e lunaria. la qual yo se per estrologia
Two strange plants: Sun and Moon above
Three plants with leaves and flowers, well drawn

msItem.ab:
Inscriptions begin:
Aquesta es la lunaria blaua perco com fa la floreta blaua, etc.
La quarta lunaria es aquesta. E com la trobaras cerqua la lunaria dins, etc.
Aquesta es reymerola o lunaria menor, etc.
Martagon en senis etc.
Table of planets, names of the week-days in Catalan at top
msItem.rubric: Declaratio de la taula precedent
msItem.incipit: Si tu uols saber les set planetes com regne en lo dia y en la nyt
msItem.explicit: apparra be alhom be intuent. deo gracias

msItem.head: Robert Green of Welby, De fama

head.title: Epistola Roberti de Welbe de fama, 1506

msItem.rubric: Omnibus asumptis rebus maneat tibi fama Intemerata. minus sic tua fata lues
msItem.incipit: Fama namque si tibi sit integra serues quisquis es pro viribus
msItem.explicit: et causas euita que oppugnarent eam. Et hec de fama sufficiant
msItem.ab: (over erasure: Robertus G(rene) de Welbe. Anno 1506. in las..)

ab.supplied: Rob. Grene de Welbe. Robert Welby proctor 1479-80 occurs in Grace Book A, pp. xxxii and 142: Robert Welby in Grace Book B I for ad eiusdem degrees 1492 and 3, pp. 38, 65 (H. P. S.)

msItem.head: RamÛn Lull, Tertia distinctio

head.title: Tertia distinctio seu pars libri Raymundi de quinta essentia

msItem.rubric: Incipit tercia disti(n)ctio que est de alteracione metallorum et de magisterio eorum et medicina
msItem.incipit: Hec est tercia distincio huius libri que est de cura metallorum

ab.decoNote: Good diagrams, and a pretty volvel on 124, 125, 158

msItem.explicit: omnium principiorum ut secundum ea que dicta sunt
msItem.rubric: Taula en pla de les significations de les letres del arbre e de les figuras posades en aquesta art transmutatoria. E primerament del arbre
msItem.incipit: A significa chaos que uol dir confussio
Recipe Áo es prenets una onÁa de luna bona e fina

msItem.head: Hortulanos, Commentary on the Emerald Table of Hermes. Averroes, Operatio lapidis

head.title: Expositio epistolae Hermetis, et operatio lapidis per Averroem

msItem.rubric: Expositio epistole hermetis post Ortholanum et est Auerrois prologus
msItem.incipit: Huius libelli series sequentibus splendet capitulis
msItem.rubric: Sequitur epistola
msItem.incipit: Dicit ergo philosophus sic. Verum est et verissimum
msItem.rubric: Explicit epistola
Exposicio
msItem.incipit: Exponitur sic. Verum est dicit ad dandum intelligi
msItem.explicit: Et sic completum est quod dixit de operacione solis. Et sic explicit expositio epistolae hermetis secundum Auerroys philosophum
msItem.rubric: deo gracias

seg.explicit: lapis fuerit optime preparatus. Et sic explicit Auerroys

msItem.head: Robert Green of Welby, Quaestiones super benedicti lapidis philosophici compositione
msItem.rubric: Questiones perutiles super benedicti lapidis philosophici compositione
msItem.incipit: Questiones lapidis benedicti. Questio prima. quoniam aqua nostra ex plumbo
msItem.explicit: cum paciencia consequeris. Hic concluditur tota sciencia
msItem.rubric: Explicit

msItem.head: Robert Green of Welby, Secretum

head.title: Tractatus qui dicitur, Secretum meum michi

msItem.rubric: Secretum meum michi
msItem.incipit: Est enim medicine nostre inicium ut soluatur corpus
msItem.explicit: infinita maroa videri posset. Deo gracias
msItem.rubric: Explicit Secretum meum michi omni laude dignissimum

msItem.head: Robert Green of Welby, Pulchrum somnium
msItem.rubric: In nomine Ihesu Christi Visio
msItem.incipit: Dum eram Iuuenis ibam per mundum uniuersum secreta creatoris altissimi eterne indagans
msItem.explicit: piissimo Ihesu adiuuante cui sit laus honor et gloria per infinita seculorum secula. Amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit pulcrum sompnium verum et utile

msItem.head: Robert Green of Welby, Dialogus inter Hilardum necromanticum et quendam spiritum

head.title: Dialogus inter Hilardum necromanticum et quendam spiritum

ab.quote: Quatuor ultimis tractatibus subscribitur nomen R. G. de Welbe, sed utrum ipse fuerit eorum autor vel saltem possessor codicis dubito

msItem.rubric: Dialogus inter hylardum necromanticum et quendam spiritum feliciter incipit
msItem.incipit:
Hilardus. Utrum potest fieri lapis qui dicitur philosophorum transformans omnia metalla in auri et argenti speciem.
Spiritus. In auro sunt omnia metalla
msItem.explicit: et super hoc cessauit nec ulterius loqui voluit
msItem.rubric: Explicit dialogus inter Hilardum et spiritum
msItem.ab: Occurs also in MS. Ashmole 1472, art. iii
